assignments.title: Quadratic Equations and Their Applications
assignments.subject: Mathematics
assignments.description: Solve quadratic equations using different methods and apply them to real-world problems.
questions: Solve the quadratic equation x² - 5x + 6 = 0 using factoring
Use the quadratic formula to solve 2x² + 3x - 2 = 0
A ball is thrown upward with an initial velocity of 40 ft/s from a height of 6 ft. The height h(t) = -16t² + 40t + 6. When will the ball hit the ground?
Explain when you would use factoring vs. the quadratic formula

assignments.title: The American Civil War: Causes and Consequences
assignments.subject: History

questions: Identify and explain three major causes of the American Civil War
How did economic differences between North and South contribute to the conflict?
Analyze the role of slavery in causing the Civil War
Evaluate the long-term consequences of the Civil War on American society

assignments.title: Chemical Reactions and Stoichiometry
assignments.subject: Chemistry
assignments.description: Balance chemical equations and perform stoichiometric calculations.
questions: Balance the equation: Fe + O₂ → Fe₂O₃
How many grams of water are produced when 25g of hydrogen react with excess oxygen?

Calculate the theoretical yield when 50g of CaCO₃ decomposes to form CaO and CO₂

submissions.questionId: Solve the quadratic equation x² - 5x + 6 = 0 using factoring
submissions.text: I think I need to find two numbers that multiply to 6 and add to -5. Those would be -2 and -3. So (x-2)(x-3) = 0, which means x = 2 or x = 3.
